properties.entry: K-MADe (Kernel of Model for Activity Description environment) - EN
Loading Monitor for a K-MAD project
Saving Monitor for a K-MAD project
Can not to add new concrete object, because no group available
Can not to link an event with a task, because no event available
Remove linking between event and task
No linking between event and task
Can not to add new actor, because no user available
No linking between actor and task
Can not to add new actor system, because no machine available
No linking between actor system and task

The general characteristics are the first ones to enter and are to be used by all people involved in the activity analysis. These characteristics are informal and do not refer to the state-of-the-world objects

For each task of a task tree, a unique number is defined. It incorporates the depth of a task as well as its position towards its "sister-tasks" (same level tasks). That number is automatically generated and is not editable
Indicates the "mother-task" (upper-level task) of that task
Indicates the name of the task provided by the analyst
Indicates the goal assigned to the task
That characteristic allows to complement the task goal with additional multimedia information (video or sound)
That characteristic allows to label a task in order to help further identifying a task. A label, or tag can be associated with a colour
That characteristic allows to list all the objects used by a task
That characteristic allows to describe the user observable (or expected) effects resulting from a task
That indicates the task duration. All sorts of time related informations are accepted
Indicates who performs the task. The possible values are: "user, system, interactive, and abstract, unknown"
Indicates the nature of the action performed by the executant "User"
That characteristic corresponds to an indication of the iterative nature of the task
That characteristic allows to set a value for the task frequency
Indicates the priority of a task towards other task of the same level
Indicates if a task is mandatory or optional. A mandatory task must be executed while an optional task can be omitted
Indicates if a task is interruptible or not
This characteristic indicates that task execution is constrained by an event
This characteristic contains the list of users allowed to execute a task
This characteristic describes the way the sub-tasks of an upper-level task will be executed
This characteristic indicates that task execution is constrained by a condition. That condition relates to the objects manipulated by the user: the state-of-the-world objects

That characteristic allows to precise the iterative nature of a tasks that can be executed several times and/or until a particular condition is satisfied. That condition relates to the objects manipulated by the user
This characteristic contains the list of machines allowed to execute a task
That characteristic modifies the objects of the state-of-the-world
That characteristic generates a set of events
No codec available : Need to instal QuickTime (Apple)
No older task (task on the left)
No young task (task on the right)
